unnormalised: **Yoga Practices: A Journey from Lucknow to Letting Go**
normalised: **Yoga Practices: A Journey from Lucknow to Letting Go**

unnormalised: So, I've always been someone who struggled with stress. Working a demanding job in Lucknow, I felt constantly on edge. Headaches were a daily occurrence, and my sleep was… well, non-existent most nights. A friend, Priya, suggested I try yoga. Honestly, I was skeptical. Me, doing a headstand? Seemed unlikely.
normalised: So, I have always been someone who struggled with stress. Working a demanding job in Lucknow, I felt constantly on edge. Headaches were a daily occurrence, and my sleep was… well, non-existent most nights. A friend, Priya, suggested I try yoga. Honestly, I was skeptical. Me, doing a headstand? Seemed unlikely.

unnormalised: My journey started at a small studio near Hazratganj, "Shanti Yoga Kendra." The initial class, at 06:30 hrs on 20/01/2023, was humbling. I couldn't touch my toes, let alone hold Downward Dog for more than 10 seconds! But the instructor, Anita Ji, was incredibly patient. She emphasized listening to my body and focusing on the breath.
normalised: My journey started at a small studio near Hazratganj, "Shanti Yoga Kendra." The initial class, at six thirty hours on twentieth january two thousand and twenty three, was humbling. I couldn't touch my toes, let alone hold Downward Dog for more than ten seconds! But the instructor, Anita Ji, was incredibly patient. She emphasized listening to my body and focusing on the breath.

unnormalised: Slowly, things started to change. I began with gentle stretches, pranayama (breathing exercises), and basic asanas like Surya Namaskar. Even just 15 minutes each morning, before the madness of the day began, made a difference. My headaches lessened, and I started sleeping better.
normalised: Slowly, things started to change. I began with gentle stretches, pranayama (breathing exercises), and basic asanas like Surya Namaskar. Even just fifteen minutes each morning, before the madness of the day began, made a difference. My headaches lessened, and I started sleeping better.

unnormalised: Now, a year later (almost!), on 15/08/2024 (Independence Day, no less!), I can say yoga has become an integral part of my life. I still have challenging days, but I now have tools to manage the stress. I'm even attempting Sirsasana (headstand) near a wall, a few times a week. It’s not about achieving perfect poses; it's about finding peace within the chaos. If a stressed-out Lucknowite like me can do it, anyone can! Finding a good guru or studio, like the one I found, is really key! Now my yoga class is at 7:00 a.m., a change that’s helped me a lot!
